Subjective: For the past 1.5 weeks, the patient has had continuous pain in the lower right back.
Pain radiates down the dorsal side of the right upper leg.
Pain radiates down the lateral side of the right lower leg to the right foot.
Paracetamol does not relieve the pain.
Ibuprofen does not relieve the pain.
Patient does not experience any subjective loss of strength in the legs.
Movement is restricted by the pain
The patient experiences a dull sensation on the outside of the right lower leg extending to the foot.
The patient experiences slight tingling on the outside of the right lower leg extending to the foot.
There is no loss of sensation in the riding breeches area.
The patient mainly wants to reduce the pain.
Objective: There are no visible abnormalities on the back.
There are no visible abnormalities on the legs.
There is no pressure pain across the spine.
Straight Leg Raise on the right is positive.
Straight Leg Raise left is negative.
There is hypesthesia on the lateral side of the right lower leg.
There is hypesthesia on the lateral side of the right foot.
The strength in both legs is symmetrical.
The strength in both legs is normal.
The tendon reflexes in the legs are normal
Assessment: There is a right-sided lumbar radicular syndrome, suspected herniated nucleus pulposus.
There are no indications of cauda equina syndrome.
There are no indications of severe neurological deficit.
Plan: Pregabalin will be slowly increased according to schedule.
The advice is to not drive a car during the pregabalin build-up phase.
The patient will be referred for physiotherapy.
Information has been provided about herniated nucleus pulposus/lumbar radicular syndrome.
Information has been provided about the expected course of the symptoms.
Information has been provided about the expected treatment.
Contact us immediately in case of new loss of strength.
Contact us immediately in case of loss of sensation in the riding breeches area.
Contact us immediately in case of urinary problems.
Contact us immediately in case of bowel problems.
A follow-up appointment has been schedled in 1 week.
